cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift north-northwest toward the South Carolina coast through Saturday, cross inland over the Carolinas Sundayâ€“Monday, then recurve northeast and move back offshore near the Mid-Atlantic/New England coast by Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast between Edisto Beach and Cape Lookout

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from South Carolina northward to the Mid-Atlantic and portions of southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (4%) of experiencing tropical-storm-force winds; any winds likely to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Boston waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain possible late Monday night through Tuesday as the remnant low passes offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf and rip-current risk along the Massachusetts beaches early next week.
